meanings.definition: A person who jokes or teases in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: The kidder in our class always makes everyone laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent2: My little brother is such a kidder; he loves to play pranks on us.
meanings.sent3: The kidder at the party had everyone in stitches with their funny stories.
meanings.sent4: Her dad is known as the office kidder, always lightening the mood with his humor.
meanings.sent5: The kidder's jokes were so witty that even the teacher couldn't help but chuckle.

meanings.definition: To joke or tease in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: During lunch, my friends and I like to kidder around and have a good time.
meanings.sent2: Don't take him seriously; he's just trying to kidder you with his silly remarks.
meanings.sent3: I decided to kidder my sister by hiding her favorite toy, just to see her reaction.
meanings.sent4: The siblings would often kidder each other, but their bond was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: She would kidder with her colleagues to create a friendly atmosphere at work.
